name: Peasant Uprise
storyline:
The Wine Dispute
No conflict in the entire kingdom was more absurd than the rivalry developed between the Ashly and Swayne noble families. Both families had for generations claimed to produce the best wine in the kingdom.

It's unclear if common folk around the kingdom actually cared who deserved such an unimportant recognition, but for Lord Frederick Ashlyn and Lord Eldan Swayne this was a dispute about honor.

At Arms
Words turned to shouts and soon sabotage followed. It was to no surprise that a local war broke between the two provinces. King Frey had no time for petty disputes and he allowed the two lords to resolve their differences once and for all.

Lord Eldan Swayne, overpowered by the guards of lord Frederick Ashlyn had nowhere to turn but exile. In accordance to the law, this meant that Swayne Province had just become a land owned by Lord Frederick Ashlyn.

Peasant Uprise
On the far south end of Swayne lay ground to Donnington; a small farmer's village loyal to Lord Eldan. In fear of what was to come from Lord Frederick rule, the inhabitants of Donnington gathered to listen to a commissary sent by Frederick.

If news were not favorable, how would they master the bravery and foolishness to rebel against a noble lord? How would the good King Frey view this act of treason? How would the nearby folk feel about this journey? Would they join the cause or result to mockery at the craziness of this march?

And so our story begins as news of the arrival of Ashlyn commissary reach this remote village...
summary: Peasant Uprise sets a group of peasants on a deadly quest against the new lord that has taken over their province. Unskilled in the arts of war, they will use their only known skills and tools to regain control of the Province of Swayne.
